docs.snippet: The steamship Kangaroo, from Liverpool 14th, vid Queenstown 15th inst., passed Cape Race at 11 o'clock Saturday night, and was boarded by the Press Newsboat.

docs.snippet: The storm commenced this morning.  The steamer George Peabody, from Hatteras yesterday, for New-York, put in for a harbor this afternoon. She has on board the passengers and crew of the steamer Oriental, previously reported wrecked on Body Island.

headline.main: NEWS FROM FORTRESS MONROE; Arrival of the George Peabody, with the Oriental's Passengers. LATE ADVICES FROM NEWBERN. The National Flag Raised at Raleigh, the Capital of North Carolina. Rebel Outrages upon Unionists.

docs.abstract: Union flag reportedly raised over Raleigh, NC
docs.lead_paragraph: The storm commenced this morning. The steamer George Peabody, from Hatteras yesterday, for New-York, put in for a harbor this afternoon. She has on board the passengers and crew of the steamer Oriental, previously reported wrecked on Body Island.

docs.snippet: The immediate events of the civil war now waging, so entirely absorb public attention, that subjects which at any other time would possess the highest interest are altogether neglected.
docs.abstract: Editorial on Canada's future as independent nation; Editorial on cotton shortage in Great Britain
docs.lead_paragraph: The immediate events of the civil war now waging, so entirely absorb public attention, that subjects which at any other time would possess the highest interest are altogether neglected.

docs.snippet: THE WAR NEWS GOOD AND BAD.  The bad news from the Department of the Shenandoah, and the brillant success at Lewisburgh, have drawn attention throughout the day and evening from the army of the Potomac.

headline.main: NEWS FROM WASHINGTON.; How the War News Was Received. Speculations as to the Cause of the Disaster at Front Royal. Value of the Victory at Lewisburgh.Progress on the Tax Bill in the Senate.The House Still Debating the Confiscation Bill.OUR SPECIAL WASHINGTON DISPATCHES.

docs.lead_paragraph: THE WAR NEWS GOOD AND BAD. The bad news from the Department of the Shenandoah, and the brillant success at Lewisburgh, have drawn attention throughout the day and evening from the army of the Potomac.
